docs.lead_paragraph: "Our house is full, help us build a new home," proclaims the Web site for Covenant House Alaska, a program that helps younger people, including teenage mothers. The Alaska legislature decided to allocate $5 million in building funds, but Gov. Sarah Palin cut that to $3.9 million with a line-item veto in June.

headline.main: Palin's Budget Cuts Affect Teenage Mothers

docs.abstract: Among millions of dollars the Alaska governor trimmed from the state budget was one-fifth of an allocation for expanding a shelter for troubled teenagers, including pregnant girls and new mothers.
docs.snippet: Among millions of dollars the Alaska governor trimmed from the state budget was one-fifth of an allocation for expanding a shelter for troubled teenagers, including pregnant girls and new mothers.

docs.lead_paragraph: More campaign-related opinion for Wednesday, Sept. 3:
docs.abstract: More campaign-related opinion for Wednesday, Sept. 3.
docs.snippet: More campaign-related opinion for Wednesday, Sept. 3.

docs.lead_paragraph: It will be Sarah Palin's big night in the Republican National Convention, where she will introduce herself to the country as the Republican candidate for the vice presidency. While millions may gather before their TVs to watch her speak, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has told reporters he has other plans."I'm actually going to the theater tonight to see Whoopi Goldberg in 'Xanadu,' " the mayor said after a noontime announcement on Wednesday at the Tweed Courthouse in Manhattan.
docs.abstract: Rather than watch the vice presidential speech, the mayor plans to see Whoopi Goldberg in "Xanadu."
docs.snippet: Rather than watch the vice presidential speech, the mayor plans to see Whoopi Goldberg in "Xanadu."

docs.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS - Airport greetings are usually pretty staid, scripted affairs, but when Senator John McCain landed here Wednesday to claim the Republican presidential nomination the scene on the tarmac was a bit more emotional than usual.

headline.main: Palin Family Welcomes McCain to Twin Cities

docs.abstract: When John McCain greeted his own family, and that of his running mate, he lingered a little extra when he got to Bristol Palin, Ms. Palin's 17-year-old, whose pregnancy made national news this week.
docs.snippet: When John McCain greeted his own family, and that of his running mate, he lingered a little extra when he got to Bristol Palin, Ms. Palin's 17-year-old, whose pregnancy made national news this week.

docs.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL -- Back in the day when he ruled the Capitol as House Republican leader, Tom DeLay was known as The Hammer for his take-no-prisoners approach to politics. But the old Hammer sounded almost warm and fuzzy at the Xcel Energy Center here this morning, as he wandered along Radio Row granting quick interviews on demand. We asked if he had any advice for Alaska Gov. Sarah Palin, who makes her nationally televised convention debut as John McCain's running mate with a prime-time speech tonight.

headline.main: DeLay Offers Advice to Palin: Be Yourself

docs.abstract: The former Republican congressman says the Alaska governor should offer up a speech that extols the way she lives her life and talk about her principles.
docs.snippet: The former Republican congressman says the Alaska governor should offer up a speech that extols the way she lives her life and talk about her principles.

docs.lead_paragraph: Aired Tuesday night on NBC: From what I understand, President Bush is very upset that John McCain has picked Alaskan Governor Sarah Palin to be his vice presidential running mate. Bush said: "Alaska? Why couldn't he have picked someone from America?"
docs.abstract: Aired Tuesday night on NBC: From what I understand, President Bush is very upset that John McCain has picked Alaskan Governor Sarah Palin to be his vice presidential running mate. Bush said: "Alaska? Why couldn't he have picked someone from America?" We're learning more and more about Governor Palin. Apparently, her daughter's name is Juno, [...]
docs.snippet: Aired Tuesday night on NBC: From what I understand, President Bush is very upset that John McCain has picked Alaskan Governor Sarah Palin to be his vice presidential running mate. Bush said: "Alaska? Why couldn't he have picked someone from America?"...

docs.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL -- Gov. Sarah Palin spent about 10 minutes at the Xcel Energy Center this morning, checking out the stage and the environs in preparation for the speech she will give tonight. Introduced to the nation less than a week ago, Ms. Palin faces the daunting task of speaking directly to voters about her vision and how her experiences as Alaska's governor would complement the Republican ticket in the wake of questions about her qualifications.

headline.main: The Early Word: Palin's Big Night

docs.abstract: Getting ready for the main event tonight.
docs.snippet: Getting ready for the main event tonight.

byline.original: By KATE PHILLIPS AND MICHAEL FALCONE

docs.lead_paragraph: The week’s most-covered person in politics introduces herself, and everyone has a piece of advice.
docs.snippet: The week’s most-covered person in politics introduces herself, and everyone has a piece of advice.

docs.lead_paragraph: Unable to stop the onslaught of wild soap opera story lines erupting from the Palin family, the McCain campaign offered a new mantra: “Life happens.”
